overview: The purpose of this Act is to establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the second, third, and fifth circuits. [1] This program is intended to acknowledge the distinct pathways that lead women into the criminal justice system and address their individualized needs. [1] The Act establishes temporary positions, requires a report, appropriates funds, and sunsets on 6/30/2028. [1]
appropriations: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ (HB727) or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] The funds are for equipment; mental health, substance abuse treatment, and other services; and the establishment of seven temporary positions. [1] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary for the purposes of this Act. [1]
assumptions_and_methodology: The proposed pilot program is based on a prior program established by Act 243, Session Laws of Hawaii 2022, in the circuit court of the first circuit. [1] The first circuit's program, known as Mohala Wahine, began accepting participants in January of 2023, with a goal of admitting twenty women each year. [1] The appropriation for the new pilot program is intended to fund seven temporary positions, including social workers, circuit court clerks, and judicial clerks, as well as equipment and treatment services. [1] [1]
agency_impact: There is established within the second, third, and fifth circuits of the judiciary the women's court pilot program. [1] The judiciary is responsible for implementing the program and expending the appropriated sums. [1] [1] The judiciary shall also submit a report of its findings and recommendations to the governor and legislature prior to the regular sessions of 2026, 2027, and 2028. [1]
economic_impact: The program's goal is to divert participants from incarceration, support their success in the community, and reduce recidivism. [1] Women offenders face unique barriers such as lower educational attainment, lack of stable work history, and economic or social marginalization. [1] The services offered by the program include life-skills training, education and vocational training, and housing support, which can address these barriers. [1] [1]
policy_impact: This Act builds upon Act 243, Session Laws of Hawaii 2022, which established a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the first circuit. [1] This measure establishes a temporary three-year woman's court pilot program within the second, third, and fifth circuits. [1] [1] The Act shall take effect on July 1, 2025, and shall be repealed on June 30, 2028. [1]
revenue_sources: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ (HB727) or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026. [1] The same sum is appropriated for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary. [1]

[1] [1] These funds are for equipment, mental health and substance abuse treatment services, and the establishment of seven temporary positions.
